diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@    required: true

  mode:
    description:
    - Specifies the link policy for the ifgrp.

comments.body: This module UI seems incorrect. It allows addition of one port at a time, but does not allow removal of a port at all (without trashing the ifgrp too). The "right" way to do this is to make this member a list- this is the same issue with people usually expecting to be able to work with both an absolute list, eg, "these and only these ports should be in the ifgrp" vs "ensure these ports are in the ifgrp but leave others not mentioned". Either is fine (possibly with a mode switch to support both), but the module's not terribly usable when you can only add one port at a time and not remove at all- it's confusing for the way people typically interact with Ansible modules.
We will look in to this for the next release.
